meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being hypocritically self-righteous or moralistic.
meanings.sent1: Her pharisaicalness was evident in her constant judgment of others.
meanings.sent2: His pharisaicalness was revealed when he preached about honesty but lied himself.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the pharisaicalness of politicians who claim to be honest.
meanings.sent4: The pharisaicalness of the company's ethical standards was exposed by the whistleblower.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's pharisaicalness made her unpopular among the students.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of someone who pretends to be more virtuous or religious than they really are.
meanings.sent1: His pharisaicalness was seen through his public displays of charity while mistreating his employees.
meanings.sent2: She used her pharisaicalness to gain favor with the community, but her true nature was eventually revealed.
meanings.sent3: The pharisaicalness of the celebrity preacher was exposed when scandalous photos surfaced.
meanings.sent4: The politician's pharisaicalness was evident in his speeches about integrity while engaging in corrupt practices.
meanings.sent5: The pharisaicalness of the social media influencer was shattered when her private messages were leaked.
